cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 mi E of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest then turning north-northwest, skirting the east coast of Florida toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the southeast Florida coast in the vicinity of Palm Beach/Broward counties

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect immediately south of the port; Storm Surge Watch begins at Jupiter Inlet northward
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton to the Volusia/Flagler County Line, FL (includes Palm Beach County)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coastline from Miami-Dade through Palm Beach County and northward along the Florida east coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely with a 75% chance; hurricane-force gusts possible (Category-1 strength)
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along Palm Beach County shoreline, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches could cause localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-lived port-access restrictions due to rough seas
